pr_title: fix: fix handling of intersection types for lambda parameters

timeline.bodyText: refactor the else block in getOverriddenMethodForIntersectionType?
timeline.author: monperrus

timeline.bodyText: do we need to move this check here? could we keep it at the previous place?
timeline.author: monperrus

replies.bodyText:
It follows the standard compiler behavior.
That is, at least one interface should have one method,
thus, some of these interfaces might not even declare any methods.
But as a side note, I just match the type that will be taken by the lambda in its parent,
but I did not implement a real type intersection, thus I am less strict than the compiler.
A great improvement would be to implement this type intersection in spoon.
But it is too complicated for me :/ and I would not be useful for my use case.
replies.author: quentinLeDilavrec

timeline.bodyText:
could you add a one line comment stating the test intention in natural language:
// contract: intersection types on lambda parameters are supported
timeline.author: monperrus

timeline.message:
rename auxilary
from getOverriddenMethodAux
to getOverriddenMethodForIntersectionType
